home.title: Dar-ul-Qaza Muslim Personal Law Court
home.subtitle: A Digital Portal for Shariah-Compliant Marital Dissolution & Judicial Records
home.selectDivorceType: Please select a matter to proceed
home.trustText: Our digital court ensures that all marital matters are handled with the highest degree of Shariah integrity and legal precision.
home.understandingText1: DAR-UL-QAZA provides a structured framework for resolving marital disputes under Muslim Personal Law.
home.understandingText2: From initial application to final Order Sheet, every step is documented and reviewed by qualified Islamic authorities.
home.understandingText3: All decisions issued are digitally authenticated and legally recognized within the community framework.
home.contactUsDesc: Reach out for help with filing your application.

documents.title: Document Verification
documents.secureNote: Your documents are securely stored and accessible only to authorized court officials.

talaq.title: Talaq
talaq.details: Formal registration of Talaq declarations as per Shariah.

khula.title: Khula
khula.details: Dissolution via mutual consent or judicial request.

faskh.title: Faskh-e-Nikah
faskh.details: Dissolution ordered by Qazi based on valid grounds.

zaujiyat.title: Talaq-e-Zaujiyat
zaujiyat.details: Specialized divorce proceeding for specific marital cases.

virasat.title: Virasat
virasat.details: Resolution of disputes regarding inheritance and maintenance.

zauj_nama.title: Zauj Nama
zauj_nama.details: Verification and resolution of Nikahnama discrepancies.

dashboard.title: My Judicial Cases
dashboard.unableToLoad: Unable to load cases. Please check your connection.
dashboard.timelineGuidance: This process follows a structured Islamic approach to ensure fairness and reflection (Iddat), avoiding hasty decisions.
dashboard.activeCaseWarnDesc: You must complete or close your current case before starting a new one.
dashboard.noActiveCaseDesc: Select a case type above to begin your application.

auth.required: Authentication required to access court records.

Talaq.name: Talaq (Divorce by Husband)
Talaq.description: Formalizing divorce initiated by the husband.

Khula.name: Khula (Divorce by Wife)
Khula.description: Dissolution of marriage through mutual agreement/wife's request.

Faskh-e-Nikah.name: Faskh-e-Nikah (Judicial Dissolution)
Faskh-e-Nikah.description: Dissolution of marriage by order of the Qazi based on valid grounds.

Talaq-e-Zaujiyat.name: Talaq-e-Zaujiyat
Talaq-e-Zaujiyat.description: Specific divorce proceeding handled via Shariah protocols.

Virasat.name: Virasat
Virasat.description: Judicial matter relating to inheritance rights and formal proceedings.

Zauj Nama Dispute.name: Zauj Nama Dispute
Zauj Nama Dispute.description: Resolution of disputes related to marital documentation.

sections.mandatoryMessage: The Darkhast (Request Application) is a mandatory prerequisite. Kindly complete this form to proceed with your case submission.

errors.evidence: Mandatory: Evidence documentation required for Faskh cases.

notice.title: Court Notice
notice.body: By order of the Qazi, a notice is hereby issued in the case of {{type}}. The parties are directed to appear before this court for the scheduled hearing as stated below.

hearing.title: Official Hearing Records
hearing.subtitle: Dar-ul-Qaza Court Certified Digital Record
hearing.waitingRecords: Waiting for official records to be uploaded by the court clerk.

arbitration.title: Compulsory Arbitration (Sulh)
arbitration.subtitle: Mandatory reconciliation attempt as required by Shariah Law.
arbitration.success: The parties have mutually agreed to reconcile. The case has been closed as successful Sulh.

faisla.title: Order Sheet
faisla.subtitle: Official Judicial Record • Dar-ul-Qaza Nanded
faisla.downloadText: Your final judgment has been formalized. You may now download your Shariah-compliant divorce certificate.

footer.jurisdictionText: Dar-ul-Qaza operates within the framework of Muslim Personal Law (Shariat) Application Act. Decisions are binding within the community consensus and provide a documented basis for civil legal recognition where applicable.
footer.address: Dar-ul-Qaza Central Registry, Nanded, Maharashtra, India
footer.copyright: © {{year}} Dar-ul-Qaza Digital Portal. All rights reserved.

signIn.title: Sign In to Darul Qaza
signIn.subtitle: Access your judicial portal and manage your cases

signUp.title: Create an Account
signUp.subtitle: Register to start your official judicial application
